file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-50-06-04 - MAIN-DOOR EMERGENCY LIGHT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL MAIN-DOOR EMERGENCY LIGHT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the main-door emergency-light lamp and the main-door emergency-light assembly. B. The main-door emergency light is installed in the main-door ceiling panel and illuminates the exit area in an emergency condition. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY MAIN-DOOR EMERGENCY-LIGHT LAMP - ALL 33-50-06-000-801-A REMOVAL MAIN-DOOR EMERGENCY-LIGHT LAMP - ALL 33-50-06-400-801-A INSTALLATION MAIN-DOOR EMERGENCY-LIGHT AS- ALL 33-50-06-000-802-A SEMBLY - REMOVAL MAIN-DOOR EMERGENCY-LIGHT AS- ALL 33-50-06-400-802-A SEMBLY - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-50-06 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-06-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. MAIN-DOOR EMERGENCY-LIGHT LAMP - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the main-door emergency-light lamp. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Passenger cabin (main-door ceiling 233 233ALC panel) C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin (main-door ceiling panel) H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the EMERG circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Carefully pull the lens (3) to remove it. (2) Remove the emergency lamp (2) from the light housing assembly (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-50-06 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Main-Door Emergency-Light Lamp - Removal/Installation Figure 401 ZONES B 233 A EXIT DET. A MAIN-DOOR CEILING PANEL (REF.) 1. LIGHT HOUSING ASSEMBLY 2. EMERGENCY LAMP DET. B 3. LENS 145AMM330175.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-50-06 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-06-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. MAIN-DOOR EMERGENCY-LIGHT LAMP - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the main-door emergency-light lamp. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500 EMERGENCY LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Passenger cabin (main-door ceiling 233 233ALC panel) D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin (main-door ceiling panel) I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the emergency lamp (2) in the light housing assembly (1). (2) Carefully install the lens (3). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the EMERG circuit breaker and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (2) Do the Emergency Lighting test ( AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-50-06 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

General (1) The procedures for the removal of the main-door emergency-light assembly are given in Main-Door Courtesy-Light Assembly Removal ( AMM TASK 33-26-04-000-802-A/400). B.
